abstract: After a meeting of the top 50 executives of Bear Stearns, the group has embraced Alan D. Schwartz as the firm’s sole president and likely successor to the chief executive James E. Cayne.
snippet: After a meeting of the top 50 executives of Bear Stearns, the group has embraced Alan D. Schwartz as the firm’s sole president and likely successor to the chief executive James E. Cayne.
lead_paragraph: Yesterday morning, the top 50 executives of Bear Stearns filed into the firm’s 12th-floor dining room. Nerves were taut — Bear’s president in charge of its bond business, Warren J. Spector, had just been forced out in the wake of the collapse last month of two of the firm’s hedge funds.

headline.main: Bear Stearns Heir Apparent Tries to Restore Some Faith
headline.print_headline: Bear Stearns Heir Apparent Tries to Restore Some Faith
